You have changed the umbraco path from the default.
Your umbraco path is not in the umbracoReservedPaths appSetting value.
You should consider changing the umbraco path for security reasons.
In the appSettings, change the value of Umbraco.Core.Path to something not obvious to hackers, like my-secret-backoffice-url (use - instead of spaces.)
Add this to the other appSetting Umbraco.Core.ReservedPaths. You can replace ~/umbraco
Change the name of the umbraco folder to be the same name.
Test that everything still works.
BEWARE This could break some packages which rely on the default umbraco path, so test it first.

Examine rebuild on startup is disabled.
For sites with lots of content, having Examine rebuild enabled on start can really slow down boot time.
Fix
This will add RebuildOnAppStart="false" to the Examine config file.
Successfully updated the Examine config file.
Unable to update the Examine config file.
Outgoing connections from your website are being served over an old protocol. You should consider updating it to use TLS 1.2 or higher.
Your website is set up to use TLS 1.2 for outgoing connections.
HSTS is enabled

The HSTS Policy helps protect web application users against some passive (eavesdropping) and active network attacks. A man-in-the-middle attacker has a greatly reduced ability to intercept requests and responses between a user and a web application server while the user's browser has HSTS Policy in effect for that web application.
Set Header in Config
This will add the HSTS header to the web.config file.
Successfully added HSTS settings to the web.config file.
Unable to update the web.config file.
ImageProcessor.Web.PostProcessor is installed.
If you install the NuGet package ImageProcessor.Web.PostProcessor, it will add optimisations that can reduce images by up to 60% in certain circumstances, just by having the package installed.
